cookbook_disinterested: ^I see a book on the shelf, it's titled "Shad's Cookbook." all in crayon. It smells faintly of burnt sugar.
^"Oh, That's my legacy. Well, one of them... for now."
^"This feels less like a cookbook and more like a fire hazard paperback edition."
^"Have you ever thought of making something serious?"
^Shad closes the book and takes it from me, he does it gently like he's not used to people take it or him seriously.
cookbook_flirty: ^I see a book on the shelf, it's titled "Shad's Cookbook." all in crayon. The spiral binding is a little bent but you can tell the book is well loved.
^"You found it! That's the deluxe first ediiton - written entirely in crayon by me."
^Shad opens the book. The first page is titled "Boomberry Pie." it's accompanies by a warning "Do not attempt unless supervised or desperate."
^"I needed to have something for when publishers come knocking. This is my official master piece!"
^"I see you gave yourself 5 stars on the back cover."
^"Self confidence is the secret ingredient after all. Well, that and...paprika."
^I flip through more pages, each recipe has a fever of ingredients and bright enthusiastic annotations.
^"You have a dish called 'Flaming Passion Pasta'... is that suppose to be literal or romantic?
^Shad throws me a devishly handsome smile and wink
^I chuckle and close the cookbook. I walk over to him and brush my arm against his while returning it to it's rightful place.
